From: Jean-Baptiste Mouret <jeanbaptiste.mouret@...>

Hi Ken,

On 14 Jun 2015, at 08:47, kstanley@... [neat] <neat@yaho=
ogroups.com> wrote:

> Hi Jean-Baptiste, congrats of course to you and your=
 coauthors on the great paper.  It's good for the field too to get this kin=
d of prominent exposure doing something with real-world relevance.  The com=
bination of evolution and later policy-search RL also looks like a nice pra=
ctical idea with many future applications.

Thank you for the kind words!

=
> One detail I'm particularly interested in learning more about is the use =
of this approach with SUPGs on a real robot.  I guess I'll have to wait for=
 the ECAL paper but I'd love to learn more about that.  I know your group h=
as done a lot of work already investigating the properties of SUPGs, and se=
eing how they work in a MAP-Elites map would be very interesting.

As I sai=
d on Tuesday =93it works=94 but:
- We have troubles to fill the map with SU=
PG with some behavioural descriptors. Nevertheless, it works well with the =
=93orientation=94 behaviour descriptor. We definitely need to understand wh=
y it is that hard to combine SUPG and MAP-Elites (I expected this to be tri=
vial).
- We have some technical problems to sense the contact between the f=
eet and the ground with our real robot. We plan to buy a few sensors for th=
is but it is expensive (7000 euros). For now, we are exciting the SUPG with=
 a clock instead of the contact sensor, but this makes it =93open-loop=94, =
which is less interesting than a closed-loop controller.
- Danesh Tarapore =
will give a short talk about this at the EPS workshop at Ecal and we have a=
n arxiv report about this =93in preparation=94.

Best regards,
=97 Jean-Bap=
tiste Mouret
http://pages.isir.upmc.fr/~mouret/
